name: Manchester United 1912-1921 Quiz | Manchester United | 10 Questions

questions.text: 1912: Something relatively unknown happened at Manchester United in this year for the first time, but what was that strange thing?
questions.correct: United signed a player from Liverpool
options: United won every game at home
United went unbeaten throughout the season
questions.explanation:
United signed a player from Liverpool.

	In August 1912, half-back Tom Chorlton signed on a free transfer from, Liverpool, who have become in recent times, United's bitter rivals. The only other times this has happened was in 1929 when forward Tommy Reid joined the club, and 1938, when half-backs Ted Savage and Allenby Chilton signed on for free. Also in this year, Ernest Mangnall resigned and J.J.Bentley took over as secretary.

questions.text: 1913: United had their highest league finish for the decade this year, but what position was it?
questions.explanation:
4th.

	United played 38 games, won 19, drawn 8 and lost 11 times during this campaign, which saw Sunderland clinch the title.

questions.text: 1914: Dick Holden left United to voluntarily fight in World War I. Which of these armed services did he sign up for?
questions.explanation:
Royal Air Force.

	Holden made 117 appearances for the club with no goals to his credit. Also in this year, John Robson became United's manager.

questions.text: 1915: United struggled in the league this year, and finished the season with 30 points. Were they relegated?
questions.explanation:
No.

	United finished 2 points above Tottenham Hotspur, who were relegated into division two.

questions.text: 1916: The outbreak of the World War I in 1914 caused a halt to the league campaign between seasons 1915-1919, but United still kept busy. Which future United manager was signed as a player this year?
questions.explanation:
Clarence Hilditch.

	Hilditch was signed from Altrincham, and went on to play 322 games for United, with 7 goals scored. He managed the club between 1926-27.

questions.text: 1917: Only one player was signed this year because of World War I. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Tommy Meehan.

	Although Meehan was signed in 1917, it wasn't until two years later that he was able to play competitive football for the club, when he made 53 appearances and scored 6 goals between 1919-20.

questions.text: 1918: What tournament did United play in this year?
questions.explanation:
Lancashire Section Principal Tournament.

	Other teams that featured in this 'league' included Liverpool, Burnley, Manchester City and Blackburn Rovers.

questions.text: 1919: Which two players signed for the club from Army football this year?
questions.explanation:
John Williamson & George Bissett.

	An amazing 13 players were signed, and 15 left during this year.

questions.text: 1920: After the resumption of the league, what position did United finish this year?
questions.explanation:
12th.

	United finished mid-table, playing 42, winning 13, drawing 14 and losing 15 games.

questions.text: 1921: United paid a total of 10,575 pounds for eleven new players, but which of these cost the most?
questions.explanation:
Neil McBain.

	United paid 6,000 pounds to Ayr United for McBain, but he only stayed for a season, later joining Everton. He played 43 games and scored 2 goals during this one season.
